nodes.bodyText: No need since this is a SPE, just call register(...)
I am registering the patterns manually since they aren’t possible with the patterns SPE registers - mainly the time of part
Not sure why I didn’t do that haha

Just remembered why I did it this way
The subtract and add methods are actually void methods, so you can’t return from them. It’s really an issue with the date implementation that should be changed.

The subtract and add methods are actually void methods, so you can’t return from them. It’s really an issue with the date implementation that should be changed.

I just did a PR for that, hopefully it gets merged soon and that can help this out :)

Shane's PR is now merged :)
you can do do return Date.now().subtract(urTimespan);
I will make changes shortly!
You may be able to use a lambda for this
maybe, but if you make it an SPE instead it would require neither a lambda nor a loop
Would it be a problem if you convert from long -> int? Overflow issues potentially?
Possibly - I’ll mess around with it :)

it could be but there's nothing he can really do with it, spigot only supports ints for these statistics so that's what we're stuck with. it won't overflow however maybe we can just not do anything if the long > Integer.MAX_VALUE
why the variable? i feel like is less clear than just using the enum where you need it

i'm not sure if player's last death is a great pattern as it's not really clear what will be returned - it could be the cause of the death or the location of the last death too (imagine teleport player to player's last death or if player's last death was caused by fall damage:)

i feel this algorithm isn't very clear - what does 0 represent? is that the milliseconds between the two dates? why does it have to be greater than 0? this is partially the fault of the Date implementation but the code would likely benefit from a comment or two here
similar thing here - why the default constructor? what does that constructor do that's special in this case. also the fault of Timespan's not so great default constructor
this isn't a simple expression, it's actually a combined expression. see javadoc of expressiontype
it'd be better to use a SimplePropertyExpression here but still register it with the standard registration method

i'm not sure if having reset as an option here is a good idea - is it really clear from looking at the code that resetting it sets it to 0? personally I would think that reset changes it to their actual time since last death before any code mucks around with it.
if I wanted to set it to 0, i'd be more likely to just write set the time of player's last death to 0
why will it return 0 seconds? shouldn't it be null?
I went back and forth about this myself, but wasn’t sure what would be better. Either are possible so I can change it

you've got to override toString too, the current return would be the time since of now

  
    
      Skript/src/main/java/ch/njol/skript/expressions/base/SimplePropertyExpression.java
    
    
         Line 60
      in
      6524d69
    
    
    
    

        
          
           return "the " + getPropertyName() + " of " + getExpr().toString(e, debug);
you could also do int newTimeSinceDeath = Math.min(newTimespanInTicks, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
you could also do int newTimeSinceDeath = Math.min(newTimespanInTicks, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
missing a space before =
